greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n where n divides the product of the parts.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000 (terms n=1..73 from Antti Karttunen)
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(9) = 5 partitions are the following. The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A326149.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n=0,
program: ;; This is a naive algorithm that scans over all partitions of each n. For fold_over_partitions_of see A000793.
(define (A057568 n) (let ((z (list 0))) (fold_over_partitions_of n 1 * (lambda (partprod) (if (zero? (modulo partprod n)) (set-car! z (+ 1 (car z)))))) (car z)))
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 04 2000
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Oct 09 2000
